intro: Phyllanthus manicaensis, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, yellowish fruit that is edible and has a sweet, acidic flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
